description: US President Donald Trump issued a 3-4 day ultimatum for Hamas to accept a Gaza peace proposal, co-presented with Israeli PM Netanyahu. The plan demands Hamas disarm in exchange for a ceasefire, aid, and reconstruction, with Trump warning of severe consequences for refusal. Hamas stated it will study the internationally backed proposal before responding.

title: 'Desh ke liye jaan de dunga; Pak is no competition': Tilak Varma
description: Tilak Varma affirmed captain Suryakumar Yadav's stance that Pakistan is no competition, revealing he felt immense pressure but prioritized the nation during the Asia Cup 2025 final. His match-winning 69* off 53 balls was pivotal in India's five-wicket triumph over Pakistan, securing the title after a dramatic chase.

He emphasized physical fitness, reformed personnel records, and warned dissenting leaders to resign, drawing scrutiny for the meeting's urgency and secrecy amid broader military changes.

description: Tyreek Hill’s season is over after a devastating knee injury in the Miami Dolphins’ win over the New York Jets. The star receiver dislocated his left knee and tore multiple ligaments, including his ACL, according to ESPN’s Adam Schefter. Hill faces surgery and a long recovery, leaving Dolphins fans gutted and the team’s Super Bowl hopes in serious doubt.

This sacred day inspires courage and reminds us that great things lie ahead after hard struggles.

description: India clinched the 2025 Asia Cup crown against Pakistan, but the post-match statements garnered equal attention. Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav donated his match fees to the Indian Army, while Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha responded by donating his team's fees to civilians affected by an "Indian attack." This move could turbocharge India's rise as a global innovation hub, despite potential future tax hurdles.

description: US President Donald Trump unveiled a 20-point Gaza peace plan, proposing a ceasefire, hostage release, and a "New Gaza" governed by a technocratic Palestinian committee. Trump would chair a "Board of Peace" with Tony Blair to oversee redevelopment.

title: Woman who lost 35 kilos shares 3 tips that helped her lose weight
description: Weight loss does not always have to be a herculean task. Snigdha Baruah, who successfully shed 35 kg, shares three straightforward weight loss tips, emphasizing that fancy diets or complex workouts are unnecessary. She recommends simple strength training paired with steady-state cardio like daily steps. Additionally, Baruah advises against cutting carbs, instead focusing on portion control, and highlights the crucial role of 7-9 hours of quality sleep for recovery. Take a look.

title: JPMorgan fraud: 32-year-old CEO duped US largest bank of $175mn; sentenced for 7 yrs
description: Charlie Javice, founder of Frank, was sentenced to seven years in jail for defrauding JPMorgan Chase of $175 million. She was convicted of faking over 4 million customers to facilitate the sale of her fintech startup. The judge highlighted her duplicity while also criticizing JPMorgan's inadequate due diligence during the acquisition.

title: 'Took orders from US': BJP lashes out after Chidambaram's big 26/11 admission
description: The Bhartiya Janta Party criticized former union home minister P Chidambaram. He recently stated the UPA government did not retaliate after the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. Chidambaram mentioned foreign pressure influenced this decision. The BJP accused the Congress of mishandling the situation. They questioned the UPA's accountability regarding the terror incident. This sparked a political debate.

title: Delhi molestation case: 'Godman' shows no remorse; chats, pics found on phone
description: Self-styled godman Chaitanyanand Saraswati, 62, faces sexual harassment allegations from 17 students, with his two female aides accused of threatening victims and deleting evidence. Arrested in Agra, Saraswati shows no remorse and remains uncooperative, despite police finding incriminating chats and photos on his devices during the ongoing investigation.

title: Why the liver can’t always heal itself after quitting alcohol, scientists explain
description: New research reveals why alcohol-damaged livers cannot heal themselves. Liver cells get stuck in a repair limbo, unable to fully regenerate. RNA splicing problems and a missing protein, ESRP2, prevent tissue regrowth. Inflammation further suppresses ESRP2. These findings could lead to new treatments for alcohol-related liver disease, providing alternatives to transplants.

title: Accenture layoffs: CEO says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
description: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands of employees this year, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: China alarm: Ex-Google CEO Schmidt to US tech firms; ‘You’re up against 996’
description: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns US tech companies that remote work jeopardizes their competitiveness against China's intense "996" culture. He argues it hinders young employees' development and prioritizes work-life balance over winning. Google itself is tightening remote policies, with co-founder Sergey Brin even pushing for 60-hour weeks for AI teams, highlighting the escalating tech race.

title: Gabrielle Union on Dwyane Wade: Fear of raising kids alone amid cancer
description: Gabrielle Union revealed her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with kidney cancer, admitting she worried about raising their children alone. His secrecy regarding his health decisions caused distrust, nearly bringing their marriage to rock bottom. Wade underwent surgery in December 2023 to remove 40% of his right kidney.
